comment.body: Understood. The question was whether this (same check) applies _to all_ algorithms imported from PQClean (not just kyber and saber)? But then again, we only have aarch64 optimized code for those algorithms, so it's fine. Thanks for the explanation.

pull_request.title: Adding arm64_v8 optimized versions of saber.
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
This PR adds arm optimized versions of lightsaber, firesaber, and saber from PQClean.

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->
This PR resolves: #1122, but looks like there is an issue with upstream where the frame pointer gets corrupted. (PQCLEAN: issue [#431](https://github.com/PQClean/PQClean/issues/431#issue-1059280939))
<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -44,6 +44,18 @@ parameter-sets:
     no-secret-dependent-branching-checked-by-valgrind: true
     large-stack-usage: false
     upstream: primary-upstream
+  - upstream-id: aarch64
+    supported-platforms:
+    - architecture: ARM64_V8
+      operating_systems:
+      - Linux
+      - Darwin
+    common-crypto:
+    - SHA3: liboqs
+    no-secret-dependent-branching-claimed: false
+    no-secret-dependent-branching-checked-by-valgrind: true
comment.body:
> Is that intentional?

I can't answer that: Just checked all "no-secret-dependent-branching-checked-by-valgrind" in main branch and they're _all_ `true`, so any change to this value must be a result of the latest run of `update_docs_from_yaml.py`... Also see https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/issues/1114

comment.body: We do have a [CI job](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/f0678827043112e4c2f3854f40a1258180a0665b/.circleci/config.yml#L367) that runs the constant-time analysis on Haswell which includes AVX2.
